intro: Erlangea benadiriana, commonly known as the Benadir spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, inconspicuous flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Due to its resilience, it is sometimes used in traditional medicine and as a source of natural dyes.
